intro: Cybianthus amplus, commonly known as the broadleaf cybianthus, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and mallows. The plant is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, with a slightly hairy texture. Cybianthus amplus thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
